content: k3 row 5 rs as row 1 row 6 ws k3 sm p3 p4 yo till 2 next marker sm p1 sm p4 yo till 3 sts before next marker p3 sm k3 row 7 rs k3 sm m1l k3 *wrap repeat from * to marker m1r sm s1wyib sm m1l *wrap repeat from * till 3 sts before next marker k3 m1r sm k3 4 sts increased row 8 ws as row 4 repeat row 1-8 one more time and then repeat row 1-4 once 257 sts section 7 broken rib 2 follow instructions for broken rib 1 section 281 sts section 8 mosaic chain with cc2 row 1 rs k3 sm m1l k to next m m1r sm s1wyib sm m1l k to next m m1r sm k3 285 sts row 2 ws k3 purl to last 3 sts slipping the markers as you come to them k3 add in cc1 and continue working 2 row with cc1 and 2 row with cc2 work the following chart row 1-16 once and row 1-8 one more time remember to k3 on either side of the chart for both right and wrong side row break cc1 333 sts chart c border this easy border pattern is just like the broken rib section except that it s worked in columns of 3 sts instead of 1 with mc row 1 rs k3 sm m1l k to next m m1r sm s1wyib sm m1l knit to next m m1r sm k3 337 sts row 2 ws knit all stitches slipping the markers as you come to them work the 12 row of the border chart 2 times in total you can change the depth of the border by working more or less row but it will look best if you end with either row 6 or 12 of the chart 385 sts border chart icelandic bind-off this bind-off is stretchy enough to block the shawl and it will create a nice ridge at the bottom k1 and then transfer this stitch back to the left needle *insert right needle purl wise into first stitch on the left needle and then catch the front loop of the second stitch pull this second stitch through the first stitch but leave both stitches on the needle wrap the yarn around the right needle and knit this 2nd stitch and drop both sts from left needle return this stitch to the left needle and repeat from * until all stitches have been bound off finishing weave in all your ends i wet blocked this shawl and then used blocking wires to get nice straight edges and to stretch the shawl to the final measurements pattern by sandra buzza you can find me on ravelry and instagram as buzzaknits
